result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory Allen Melin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: with Huber for work, treatment and childcare release

miscConds.notes:
Counseling/assessments/treatment deemed appropriate by agent including sex offender assessment.
Provide DNA sample.

No contact directly or indirectly with minor children without Agent's approval - with the exception of his own children.
Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia. 
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages.

If Probation is revoked and sent to jail or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
If revoked and sent to prison, DOC shall withhold 25% of all inmates monies to pay fines/costs with the balance due as a condition of extended supervision/parole.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gregory Allen Melin

records.addlTxt: of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

9:07 AM Defendant Gregory Allen Melin appeared by phone.  Attorney Brian Maloney appeared by phone for Gregory Allen Melin.  Attorney Rebecca Meyer in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court notes plea questionnaire/waiver on file.
Deft - proceed to plea/sentencing today. Atty Maloney agrees.
Defendant waives right to an in-person hearing today. 
State - 1 year Probation with sex offender assessment and other conditions as stated on the record. Defense free to argue.
Deft pleads No Contest - Court finds Guilty.
950/Marsy's Law complied with. 
State makes sentencing argument.
Atty Maloney - essentially a joint recommendation, but requesting that Deft can have contact with own children as an exception to no contact with minor children.
Deft makes statement to Court.
Court orders 90 days Jail consecutive to any other sentence with Huber for work, treatment & child care release - imposed & Stayed in favor of 1 year Probation with conditions as stated on the record.
8 days Credit if Revoked.
Character letter from Jerry and Donna Melin

Return of search warrant-download of 3 laptops
search warrant
Sworn affidavit
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
